Half-Life delivers an interesting story, intense action and a realistic (at least at that time) world to explore. A science experiment goes wrong and leads to unforseen consequences. In order to fix all the mess the player needs to fight through many obstacles, including alien creatures, as well as some "rescue" forces. By the end you'll also get the chance to visit alien homeworld. These last chapters along with final boss were so well-designed, imo. It's a game you will never get bored of, even if you're playing it in 2016.

I know Half-Life is almost 20 years old, but still think it deserves a highest score.

10/10
THIS IS BEST GAME
Tu gfa :v

A true classic when it comes to video gaming. I recently picked up this game over the Steam Winter Sale of 2015, and enjoyed it immensely. The story is great, the combat is nice, and the puzzles implemented in the game change the pace of the action at just the right times. Everything about the game was wonderful, from the game letting you figure out what you need to do to progress to the fantastic story. Arguably Valve's Magnum Opus, this masterpiece should be played by everyone at least once in his or her life. My only regret is waiting so long to play this great game. Try it!
Good, And original

Believe me, age is the only real problem with this game. It's a frickin' masterpiece.

UPDATE: 20 years on, it's still worth your time. It's rough around the edges, but this one game is one of the most important pieces of several generations, past and future.

Still a solid first-person shooter, and it's aged pretty well gameplay-wise. If you've never played early 3D FPSes from the 90s you could still jump into this game and easily play it and have fun, as long as you don't mind the old graphics.

Half-Life довольно хорошая игрушка, но есть один изъян это 2.5 миссии, это частична миссия по рельсам и жопная миссия поверхностное натяжение которая вытрепала мои нервы, и вот последние миссии которые происходят в зене вытрепали мои нервы окончательно и испоритили мои впечатление об игре полностью после прохождение игры мои нервы вернулись в исходное состояние. А теперь плюсы, крутая на тот момент графика, достаточно хороший гемплей, неплохой сюжет и если бы не жопа разрывающие моменты то это крепкие 9 балов но а так 7.9/10 с нотяжкай в игрушку стоит по играть она хорошая.
Best game i have ever seen. Beatiful multiplayer gaming, beatiful scenerio, nice gameplay, and GORDON FREEMAN

This game was simply ahead of it's time. 
Play it for the history and the influence Half-Life made, since it is an ancient game you'll not be in awe of storyline, world, gameplay, visuals, mechanic or combat. However, when Half-Life came out it is what structured the future FPS games, it gave them a basic model of storytelling and level design. It certainly is one of the most important and influential games of all time. Even the game's engine is still being used to make stand alone games or fan made games taking place in the universe and are pretty nice. 
It isn't exactly the most "fun" experience you will have in present time.

Multiplayer community is still quite active which is incredible, even though it is just death-match but it is fun. 

Half-Life is and will always remain one of the most important and influential video-games in history. It did age surprisingly well, so yes it is one of those games that every gamer should experience. It is an achievement for sure.
Bardzo dobry FPS, polecam.

이 게임은 1990년 후반대에 만들어진, 지금의 밸브를 있게 한 명작 게임이다.

이 게임은 블랙메사 연구원 고든 프리맨의 시점으로 플레이한다.

고든은 어느 실험에 투입되어 행정관의 강행에 마지못해 반질량 분광기를 작동시키고 샘플을 집어넣지만, 연쇄공명현상에 의해 외계 생물들이 블랙메사에 침입하게 된다. 

이에 고든은 땅에 떨어져 있던 빠루를 집어들고, 과학자들의 도움으로 여러 무기로 무장히고 외계 생물들, 불신의 정부에 맞선다.
.
.
의외로 게임 시간이 길다.
연장을 집어든 고든의 시선을 따라가다 보면 스토리의 끝까지 다다르게 된다.

1990년대 게임이라 믿어지지 않는 스토리가 게임을 재밌게 한다.

하지만, 약간 잔인할 수도 있으니 다음 사람에게는 추천하지 않는다.
• 갑툭튀 공포증
• 잔인한 거 싫어하는 사람

Half-Life is a great FPS about surviving a secret government facility invaded by aliens after a scientific experiment gone wrong.

Half-Life is mostly linear (though it's a lot less obviously so than its sequel), yet the levels are still fairly well-designed, with the exception of some which are plain tedious (screw you, On A Rail.) The atmosphere is pretty good, though slightly lacking in environmental sounds, especially in Xen (an alien world you visit, which often lacks sound.) Most sounds come from nearby enemies, and those are great. They provide a feeling of tension, as you are frequentl in very tightareas and don't know where an alien (or more) is hiding. There's quite a variety of alien enemies, much more than HL2's 3 types of zombies: In total, 11 very different types of aliens, 2 bosses and 3 human enemies, all very different.

The gunplay is pretty satisfying, and there is quite a lot of variety: from standard weapons like pistol, revolver, shotgun and assault rifle wih a mini-grenade launcher, to crossbows, experimental cannons, alien hornet guns and living creatures that, when set loose, may attack you instead of your enemies! The AI also seems a lot smarter than most FPS, just due to the fact that it actually knows how to fall back when wounded to call more enemies.

The story is pretty basic (at the time it was fairly complex for an FPS, not so much today), and the ending is quite strange, but the locations you explore are fantastic, from laboratories to reactor cores to canyons to Xen, an alien world. The most irritating part of Half-Life has to be certain sections which have platforming. Platforming with the Quake Engine's momentum-heavy movement? Yeah, no.

It's still a great game, and well worth the purchase.

I have heard many things about "Half-Life" in the years before I even bought it here on Steam. Having played the "Portal" games, it gave me a sense of what Valve Corp. does with it's games. But now I've played the game that started it all for Valve. It's over twenty years late for me, but does it still work to this day? Yes it does. It's an incredibly challenging experience that was way ahead of it's time. And it's still a fun game for me, even after I endured a first playthrough.

The game was very ahead of it's time in some context, and it was trying all sorts of things games of the 1990s weren't. For one, it balances what most FPSs had, action and puzzle solving. But at the same time, it was trying to avoid the gameplay mechanics that most games used heavily. Most games at the time used cutscenes and focused more on the action than it did on the experience, which isn't necessarily a bad thing, but "Half-Life" took a chance and it paid off. 

In this game, you play Gordon Freeman, a Theoretical Physicist at the Black Mesa Compound. This game made him a silent protagonist, which is a good way to get the player immersed in the role (even if you know nothing about Freeman's field.) But this game also makes sure you never once leave Gordon's point of view, even during the in-game sequences. This makes the story unfold before you, not watching what's going on in the background, so you literally have to draw your own conclusions based on what you see and hear. That makes the game very immersive and it still works in this modern age. 

Also, rather than have levels, the game has chapters, and the areas of the game are interconnected, reducing the amount of loading screens and makes it feel more realistic. I like how they keep every game area connected to one another, making it feel like you're exploring this top-secret facility without letting the game show it for you, you're learning for yourself. 

The gameplay is what you'd expect from an FPS, though it maintains an old-school feel, even as FPSs were beginning to aim for more realism. The weapons have a nice variety, my favorite is the Tau Cannon, cause it's the closest thing to a laser gun that you have. But of course, being an FPS of the 1990s, this game uses lots of platforming and puzzle solving, requiring you to spend a lot of time saving this game. 

The enemy variety is okay, but at times, I felt that some enemies were unnecessarily tough, including the Marines. I found myself not liking to use the Assault Rifle that much, as it felt like I wasn't hitting the enemies hard enough. Also, some of the enemies were way too accurate, and their damage dealt to you was out of proportion to the amount you did (stupid Vortigaunts.) 

This brings me to the complaints I have. There is an abundance of platforming in this game, and the controls are very stiff at times, you have little control when you're in freefall, and often, the drops are too high that you take damage regardless. Also, the game has a few poor level designs. Such as when you have to turn on a fan, you have to move fast or the fan will chop you up, and you can get stuck under it. Also, there's an area that's mined, and the lasers are so finely positioned that you have no room to mess up when you try to squeeze past them. It was hard to enjoy the game at times with this problem. But that's not all. It was hard to maintain power for the HEV Suit at times (given the abundance of enemies, it was lucky you even maintained it for long periods.) Also, ammo at times felt scarce. 

But despite how much I despised certain points in the game, that just made me keep coming back and keep going. I still wanted to finish it. I was too immersed in the story. I wanted to see where I'd end up. And this game really was enjoyable, in the long run, it's another game I can come back to. 

I can see why "Half-Life" has (and rightfully earned) become one of the best games ever made. It was a game that took a lot of chance for a first-time effort by a new game company, and it was a gamble that paid off. The story and it's immersiveness are what kept me involved, even if the game wasn't totally perfect. It's the kind of FPS I know and love, and it's one I'm willing to play through again.

Índice
-Introducción
-Sobre la jugabilidad
-Sobre la historia
-Sobre su soundtrack
-Sobre su visibilidad 
-Sobre su multijugador 
-Sobre lo malo
-Conclusión
INTRODUCCIÓN
Half life es un FPS que revoluciono a la industria para siempre, su inspiración de Doom y sus innovaciones hacen que sea un juego fresco que soporta el pasar de los años. Junto a Doom, son los FPS que dominaron y siguen dominando este mundo de los videojuegos
SOBRE LA JUGABILIDAD
Ciertamente, es un juego que resulta cómodo  e intuitivo de jugar. Su acción que hace que el juego no resulte repetitivo o fastidioso: cada enemigo, situación y lugar hacen un modo de juego divertido y dinámico. Las armas que empiezan por ser básicas: pistola y escopeta, a pasar a armas grandes y poderosas- que me parecen de inspiración de Doom-, sin olvidar la poderosa palanca. Si te gustan los FPS llenos de acción, te lo recomiendo profundamente
SOBRE LA HISTORIA
Su historia me parece excelente y su narración igual: Me encanta como empieza de una situación "tranquila", que se ve desde el principio que algo no esta bien, a pasar a una situación llena de problemas. La narración te lo cuentan de manera que no resulte tedioso y aburrido: mientras juegas la historia se desarrolla por sí misma, te das cuenta de lo que esta pasando en cada situación y diálogo, aunque a veces resulta misterioso. Su historia y narración son bellas y si te gusta la ciencia ficción ve a comprarlo sin dudar
SOBRE SU SOUNDTRACK
No me parece que hubiera en demasía, algo que faltaba en algunos lugares, en mi opinión. Pero en los momentos en que sí, me parecieron adecuados y excelentes: sí que eran en relación a la situación 
SOBRE SU VISIBILIDAD
Realmente bello: su arquitectura de lugares, sus paisajes y tanto personajes amigos o enemigos. Me gusta ese escenario científico lleno de tecnología, lugares secretos llenos de... (bueno, juégalo), ese escenario final, enemigos que logran dar cierto "miedo" por así decirlo y soldados y "espías" que resultan correctos en las situaciones que se les pone, aunque en un punto parecen repetitivos los modelos soldados y los espías, así como los científicos- pero es claro por su época. Te va a agradar tu vista
SOBRE SU MULTIJUGADOR
Fue hace mucho que lo jugué y me divertí mucho, muy dinámico todo y entretenido para pasar un tiempo bueno. No estoy muy seguro como esta ahora: solo jugué unas cuantas partidas que me resultaron divertidas. Supongo que con amigos se disfrutara más, como cualquier juego por el mismo estilo. Para resumir: es divertido para pasar el rato
SOBRE LO MALO
Realmente, viendo otras reseñas y desde mi perspectiva, un problema, el más principal, son las pantallas de carga, pues arruinan la experiencia. Ciertamente esa razón es molesta, pero me parece que es justificado por su época; aunque me resulto molesto algo: cuando estaba saltando y llegaba a esas pantallas, me quedaba atorado, y tenía que cargar una partida que quedaba muy atrás de donde estaba o usar el noclip que es mejor que repetir todo un largo camino.
 Hay un gran spolier adelante, si ya lo has jugado o si no te importa adelante, bajo tu riesgo, pero si es el caso contrario salta a la conclusión
El único problema sería las pantallas de carga, por lo menos para mi, pero hay algo más: lo malo fue el enemigo final: el juego fue dinámico a lo largo de la historia, pero llegar a Nihilanth fue como solo dispararle, pasar por portales, disparar a gemas y, al final, otra vez a disparar a Nihilanth, el juego comparado con esa parte final parece que lo hicieron de manera rápida y sin pensarlo bien. Pero como me dijo un amigo Desarrollador: "Es muy difícil seguir el ritmo en un videojuego", pero supongo que comete el cometido de seguir con la historia. 
Para mi es el único fallo del videojuego a parte de las pantallas de carga
CONCLUSIÓN
¿Recomiendo el juego? Por supuesto que sí. Para mi es uno de los mejores juegos que hay. No importa cuantas veces lo juegues siempre parecerá fresco. Espero que mi reseña te haya servido para decidir si comprar o no el juego :), no te arrepentirás de comprarlo. Su calificación, de parte mía, es 9.9/10, sería 10 si no fuera por esos dos problemas...

Half-Life – легендарная игра, которая уже не требует особого представления. 
Игра, в которую хотели поиграть если и не все геймеры, то уж точно большинство. Эх, ностальгия. Гордон Фримен, ломик, хэдкрабы... сколько эмоций, вызывают эти слова. Сколько же приятных впечатлений она принесла одному 8-ми летнему школьнику в 99 году.  =)
Конечно, юное поколение геймеров уже не оценит по достоинству эту замечательную игру, так как сейчас она уже не сможет подарить тех прекрасных впечатлений, которые она дарила в свое время, время, когда она была актуальна.
Время не жалеет никого... Лет через 20 для кого-то игры 2015 года будут не интересны, скучны. Привет геймерам 2036 года и выше! Как у вас дела?
Но! Half-Life все равно остается весьма интересной игрой и рекомендуется для приобретения. А для некоторых игроков она еще является лучиком старенького, доброго тепла.

Маус одобряет! =)
Игра - легенда! Игра - шедевр! Must Have для настоящего геймера! Проходить можно бесконечно!

Half Life – ein Klassiker unter den Spielen. Auch wenn das Spiel heute nicht mehr auf dem aktuellen Stand der Technik ist, macht es jede Menge Spaß und erzählt eine wirklich gute Geschichte. 
Half Life ist vorallem für Leute geeignet, die gerne einen Sprung in die Vergangenheit der Spielegeschichte machen möchten.
Ever wanted to hit aliens with a crowbar? This game is for you! 10/10
Good game, good history, it was nice when it was released!

Che dire ... gioco davvero importante !
Forse giocarlo ora non ha avuto lo stesso valore che se lo avessi giocato ai suoi tempi, ma comunque un must-play.
Consiglio a tutti di giocarselo per farsi una bella idea di come sia iniziata l'era videoludica Valve, peró non prendetelo come gioco perfetto, ha tanti aspetti negativi dovuti all'etá, l'importante é non darci troppo peso.
Per il resto la storia ha dei risvolti davvero originali e inaspettati, mi ha fatto davvero piaere giocarlo!

Bir adet Half-Life oynama tarifi veriyorum;

Gerekenler:
- Steam
- Steam hesabı
- Half-Life oyununu almak için para
- Bir adet fare
- Bir adet bilgisayar
- Ve bir de klavye

Hazırlanışı:
- Önceden içine para yüklediğimiz PayPal/İninal kartıyla hesap bilgilerimizi kaydedip satın alma işlemini gerçekleştiriyorsunuz. Oyunu üst taraftaki "KÜTÜPHANE" yazısına geldiğinizde Half-Life oyununa faremizin sol kliğiyle tıklıyorsunuz ve oyunumuz açılmış oluyor.

Half-Life... what can i say?

1- Its a Great and Primordal game of fps and i recomend 100%
2- Its cheap
3- You can play the "Story Mode" or u can play a deathmatch whith your friends on a server
4- It uses the Source Engine, so the physic is Awsome
5- The difficulty is good (in the easy and in the normal) it isn't have a absurd difficulty level but it isnt too easy
6-The "Monsters" and the history is Very Good
7- Graphics sucks BUT if you buy the source version the graphics are good
8- You can use the content in Gmod
9- The guns, portals and the boss battle are great exemplas to how do a Great Game
10- It was VALVe 1° game
                                                        So this is my top 10
                                                         Reasons to buy Half-Life
                                              (if u like the first game buy the 2°, the 2° ep 1 nd the 2° ep 2)
  Thanks Valve, for this Great game (please, launch Half-Life 3)
